(43) 342.28th July, 1943.WAR CABINET.CERTIFICATED MARINE ENGINEERS.Directive by the Prime Minister and Minister of Defence.IN order to man the merchant ships which we expect to receive in thecoming months, 65 certificated marine engineers will have to be released from various departments each month from August 1943-March 1944. To obtainthis number of actual releases a selection field of 90 each month must be provided.Marine engineers registered under the Specified Classes of Persons (Registration)Order must be medically examined and their particulars passed to the GovernmentDepartment principally interested. Each Department must nominate for releasemonthly a number of men fit for duty at sea, proportionate to the total numberof certificated engineers in employment sponsored by it as indicated in thefollowing table : number employed.587397Admiralty ...Ministry of supply ministry of Aircraft Production (including men inthe A.I.D.) .................. 282Board of Trade (Engineer Surveyors employed by insurance Companies) ... ... ... ... 271Ministry of War Transport (including shipownersshore staffs) ... ... ... ... ... ... 185Ministry of Fuel and Power ... ... ... ... 85Ministry of Food.................. 52Ministry of Health ... ... ... ... ... 66Board of Education ... ... ... ... ... 20Other Departments ... ... ... ... ... 81[75834] 2. There are also 390 certificated engineers not yet identified as appropriate to a particular Department. These should be identified as quickly as possible and added to the figures in the above table. Meanwhile, action should proceed onthe basis of the above figures.3.
